Harmon works for the city of Tillamook as a concrete resurfacer. He has $18{,}000$ $\text{kg}$ of concrete for resurfacing streets and parking lots.  Each street he resurfaces uses $750$ $\text{kg}$ of concrete, and each parking lot uses $450$ $\text{kg}$ of concrete.

**Write an *inequality* that represents the number of streets $(S)$ and parking lots $(P)$ Harmon can resurface with the amount of concrete available.**

[[☃ expression 1]]

**Graph the constraint equation with $P$ on the horizontal axis and $S$ on the vertical axis.**

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

**If Harmon resurfaces $12$ streets $(S)$, which of the following numbers of parking lots $(P)$ can he resurface without exceeding the amount of concrete available?**
